bibl.title: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, March 10, 1929

div1.p: Carter is finished with the revisions and retyping of the bibliographic references for the History of Yellow Fever manuscript.

div1.head: Letter from Laura Armistead Carter to Wade Hampton Frost, March 10, 1929
div1.opener:
Book, Bibliography
Frost
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St. N.W.
Washington, D. C.
March 10, 1929.
Dr. Wade H. Frost,
School of Hygiene and Public Health,
615 North Wolfe Street,
Baltimore, Maryland.
Dear Jack:
div1.p:
You asked me to let you know as soon as I had finished revising
and retyping the remaining bibliographic cards for Father's MS.

Miss Brown and I went over them all today (Sunday) and they are
ready now. I could then, take them over to you at any time, beginning
to-morrow, Monday, March 11th., if there is any chance of your being
able to resume work on the final revision of the MS before the time you
set--“the middle of March.” If not, I can take them over on March 14th.
or 15th. as is most convenient to you.

It has been more of job than I anticipated and I'm a good deal
“the worse for wear” in consequence. You were right, however, in sug-
gesting it. The remaining bibliographic cards are certainly a great
improvement on their predecessors for the narrative parts of Father's MS.
Heigho! Jack, if only you and Father were doing it go-gether! What a
joy it would be to him--and how gladly I'd change places with him to
bring it about! Still, I believe he'll know when the job's done (though
I realize that you don't).

With love to the Susans and a world of gratitude (past, present
and prospective) to yourself,
